chunks.chunk_text: Hello you guys, welcome to 15 Min's Inspirations, your daily dose of English learning and motivation. You are now listening to John and in the next 15 minutes, Patrick and I will explore some powerful quotes from some of the world's most inspiring productivity gurus. So no matter whether you are commuting, working out or taking a break, join us in this episode

chunks.chunk_text: and get inspired and have fun. So let's welcome Patrick!

chunks.chunk_text: That's right you guys, let's get started with the biggest productivity guru that we've heard, Dale Carnegie. He's the author of How to Win Friends and Influence People. He said,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: So this is a quote from How to Stop Worrying and Start Living in his book, 1948.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: His breakthrough came in 1936 with How to Win Friends and Influence People, which has sold over 30 million copies and has been translated into 36 languages. What many don't know is that Carnegie changed his surname spelling from Carnegie to match that of industrialist Andrew Carnegie, hoping to benefit from the association.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: Instead of focusing on theory, he emphasized practical experience and learning from mistakes. He would have students speak about their failures and learn from them, creating a supportive environment for personal growth. The Dale Carnegie training program has graduated over 8 million people worldwide. Despite his success in teaching confidence, Carnegie himself battled depression and self-doubt throughout his life, making his achievements even more remarkable.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: The author of How to Win Friends and Influence People, Dale Carnegie, said,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: In 1912, he rented a classroom for a Christian youth conference and taught a speech. This is the beginning of the Dale Carnegie course. His breakthrough in 1936 made him famous. His book has sold over 30 million copies and has been translated into 36 languages. What many don't know is that Carnegie changed his surname spelling from C-A-R-N-A-G-E-Y to C-A-R-N-E-G-I-E, in order to make people think of industrialist Andrew Carnegie.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: His teaching method is innovative, not focusing on theory, but emphasizing practical experience and learning from mistakes. He would have students speak about their failures and learning from them, creating a supportive environment for personal growth. The Dale Carnegie training program has graduated over 8 million people worldwide. Despite his success in teaching confidence, Carnegie himself battled depression and self-doubt throughout his life, making his achievements even more remarkable.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: Next up, we have another self-help guru, Stephen Covey, the author of The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People. He said,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: he served as a Mormon missionary in England. He earned his MBA from Harvard and a doctorate from Brigham Young University. Covey spent years researching success literature from the past 200 years before writing The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People in 1989, which has sold over 25 million copies in 40 languages. The book took him over 20 years to develop. Covey created the concept of paradigm shift in personal
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: development and introduced the idea of abundance mentality versus scarcity mentality. He suffered from a severe head injury from a bicycle accident in 2012, which led to his passing, but his work continues to influence millions. He was named one of Time Magazine's 25 most influential Americans in 1996. And Covey practiced what he preached. He would wake up at 5 a.m. daily to
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: exercise and plan his day, demonstrating the first things first principle from his book.

chunks.chunk_text: Covey's book, The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People,

chunks.chunk_text: is based on the idea of abundance mentality versus scarcity mentality.

chunks.chunk_text: Covey is a motivational speaker. He said, the path to success is to take massive, determined action. This is from his book, Unlimited Power, 1986. Born Anthony J. Mohorovic in 1960, Tony Robbins grew up in a financially struggling family. He left home at 17 and worked as a janitor to support himself. His career began when he started promoting seminars from Jerome,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: his mentor. Robbins developed his own methodology by studying neuro-linguistic programming, NLP, and various psychological approaches. His breakthrough came with Unlimited Power in 1986, but he's perhaps best known for his seminars, including the famous Fire Walk experience, where participants walk across hot coals. What's less known is that Robbins has a condition called acromegaly, which caused his distinctive
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins 名人正念語錄 Inspirations Ep.15 知名自我提升大師 Famous self-development gurus.json

chunks.chunk_text: and deep voice. He has coached notable figures, including Bill Clinton, Serena Williams, and Hugh Jackman. Despite having no college degree, he's built a billion dollar business empire. Robbins feeds millions through his partnership with Feeding America, having provided over 500 million meals to date. He attributes his success to his voracious reading habit, reportedly reading 700 words per minute and averaging one book per day in his early career.
